intro: Armeria drummondii, commonly known as Drummond's thrift, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the carnation family (Caryophyllaceae) and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It has basal leaves that are linear and covered in fine hairs, and its stems are upright with a branched structure. Drummond's thrift is known for its hardiness and ability to thrive in harsh conditions, making it a common sight in desert landscapes.
